resources.string: To function properly, Retweet needs notification permissions. If permission is not granted, the app will not work. Note that some Android versions may not have the \'Read notification permission\' available, which will prevent Retweet from working on those versions.
Retweet relies on Twitter notifications to function. The Twitter app is necessary and must be set up to receive notifications on your phone.
The setup process will be finished once Retweet detects a Twitter notification. You can check back later, and we\'ll also send you a notification when it\'s complete.

Once the setup is complete, any tweet alerts received as notifications will be automatically retweeted and liked according to your settings. You can access the settings page after setup to adjust these preferences.

Retweet App allows you to automatically like & retweet Tweets without direct interaction.\\nIt is not guaranteed that it will work on all devices since Android OS is highly fragmented.\\nPlease check the setup steps below.
Below is a twitter account utilizing the functionality of this app.\\nAlso checkout the source code of the app on Github.

The retweet app works by accessing Twitter notifications and performing actions on them. Therefore it should be enabled to access notifications.\\nClick on the enable notifcations access This should open the Notification access settings. Enable the Retweet app.

NB: Not all Android version may offer this feature to the end user. This is common for android Go editions. Device manufactures choose how to modify the Android OS for their devices. Notification access is critical to the working of this app and must be enabled.\\nIf you can\'t enable it for whatever reason, the app won\'t work. This is not something we have control of, therefore we can\'t help.\\nOnce enabled, you can test by using the Test Notification feature. The retweet app will create a notification and test if it can read it. If successful, you can enable the functions for the retweet app.
Now that notification access is enabled, the next step is to ensure you can receive Twitter notifications.\\nAllow the Twitter app to send you notifications by enabling it in your phone settings

You also need to Turn on post notifications for a user inside the Twitter app. When the user tweets a post, this notification will be sent to your device. The Retweet app will then read the Twitter notification and perform the retweet & like action if enabled & available.\\nYou can turn on post notification for multiple users.

Once you have completed the setup steps, you no longer need to do anything on the Retweet app. When a Twitter notification is received, the Retweet app will perform the desired functionality as per your settings.
Some android devices may kill the Retweet app after some time. You will need to check it from time to time and re-enabling notification access when necessary.
As mentioned above, the app is not guaranteed to work on all devices.\\nThis is not something we have control over.
I have read and agree to
You need to agree to the conditions
Welcome to the Retweet app. Retweeted tweets will appear here once the app receives notifications from Twitter
Don\'t forget to leave us a review on Google Play. Your feedback is highly appreciated
In order to retweet & like a users tweet, it is recommended to turn on their post notifications
Due to Android background execution limits, some tweets may not be shown here. It is recommended to disable battery optimization for the Retweet app

You have completed the initial setup. Interaction with the app is no longer required as the likes and reposts will be performed automatically. You can check back on the app at least once a day to ensure that it\'s still running
We\'ve detected a notification from Twitter, the setup process is now complete
Ensure that you have enabled notifications from Twitter
